title: Dionne Warwick - That's What Friends Are For
description:

Lyrics:

And I never thought I'd feel this way
And as far as I'm concerned
I'm glad I got the chance to say
That I do believe, I love you

And if I should ever go away
Well, then close your eyes and try
To feel the way we do today
And then if you can remember

Keep smiling, keep shining
Knowing you can always count on me, for sure
That's what friends are for
For good times and bad times
I'll be on your side forever more
That's what friends are for

new_description:
Dionne Warwick - That's What Friends Are For: An Iconic Anthem of Friendship

The song "That's What Friends Are For" by Dionne Warwick, featuring the extraordinary talents of Elton John, Gladys Knight, and Stevie Wonder, has resonated with audiences worldwide ever since its release. This emotional anthem transcends generations, touching everyone with its heartfelt message of friendship and support. The accompanying official music video enhances the song's impact, showcasing the camaraderie and affection among these legendary artists.

Background and Inspiration

"That's What Friends Are For" was originally written by Burt Bacharach and Carole Bayer Sager. It became a massive hit when Dionne Warwick gathered a superstar lineup, including Elton John, Gladys Knight, and Stevie Wonder, to record the charity single for AIDS research and awareness. Released in 1985, the song topped the charts and raised millions for charity, leaving an enduring legacy of love and support.

Musical Composition

The song's composition blends the soulful melodies of Warwick's voice with the distinctive styles of her collaborators. Elton John's piano arrangements, Gladys Knight's powerful vocals, and Stevie Wonder's harmonica playing and soulful voice create a lush musical tapestry that perfectly complements the song's theme. The music effortlessly transitions between heartfelt verses and a rousing chorus that invites listeners to join in and celebrate friendship.

The Music Video

The official music video for "That's What Friends Are For" encapsulates the spirit of the song. Filmed in a simple yet intimate setting, the video features Dionne Warwick and her talented friends performing together, their camaraderie evident in every frame. The visual imagery captures the essence of friendship—not just as a theme of the song but as a living, breathing experience shared among the artists. Their energetic and heartfelt performances add a layer of authenticity to the video, making it a lasting tribute to genuine companionship.

Impact and Legacy

Upon its release, "That's What Friends Are For" was not only a commercial success but also a cultural phenomenon. It held the number one spot on the Billboard Hot 100 chart for four weeks and won the Grammy Award for Best Pop Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals. The song's philanthropic focus on raising awareness and funds for AIDS research broadened its impact, making it a beacon of hope for those affected by the epidemic.

The song also paved the way for future artists to use their music as a platform for charitable causes, demonstrating the power of art to effect positive change in society. The legacy of "That's What Friends Are For" continues, as it remains a staple in playlists and is often performed at charity events, nurturing a culture of generosity and empathy through music.

Celebrating a Timeless Message

The lyrical content of "That's What Friends Are For" reinforces its timeless message. Lines like "Keep smiling, keep shining, knowing you can always count on me, for sure" remind listeners of the unwavering support true friends offer one another. The song promises loyalty and companionship, capturing the essence of friendship's joyful and comforting aspects.

This message of enduring friendship, conveyed through Warwick's emotive delivery and the collaboration of her iconic friends, makes "That's What Friends Are For" an evergreen anthem. Whether encountered during life's joyful moments or times of adversity, the song provides solace and reassurance that friends will always be there to share in both triumphs and trials.

Continuing Influence

Even decades after its release, "That's What Friends Are For" continues to inspire new generations of listeners. Its presence in popular culture is enduring, with references and performances appearing in films, television, and special events. The song's universal appeal lies in its simple yet profound celebration of friendship—a theme that resonates across cultures and ages.

Dionne Warwick's masterful collaboration with Elton John, Gladys Knight, and Stevie Wonder not only brought immense talent together but also created a musical masterpiece. Their performances breathe life into the lyrics, ensuring that "That's What Friends Are For" remains a beacon of friendship and hope for audiences around the world.

In conclusion, "That's What Friends Are For" is more than just a song; it is an emblem of unity and compassion. Its enduring popularity is a testament to the power of music to bring people together and to the strength of friendships that can withstand any test of time. As you listen to this iconic track, let it remind you of the importance of those precious bonds we share with our friends.
